string-array.item: Schematic Diagram of Aquarius in Deploy-ready Mode
CONAE and NASA Components of the Aquarius/SAC-D Observatory

string-array.name: descriptions
string-array.item: Schematic diagram shows the Aquarius/SAC-D observatory stowed in the launch vehicle fairing just prior to its June 2011 launch. Credit: NASA Aquarius.
ASimplified model of the Aquarius/SAC-D observatory. Credit: NASA Aquarius.
Image delineates the SAC-D service platform built by the Space Agency of Argentina, CONAE and the NASA-contributed Aquarius instrument. Credit: NASA Aquarius.
Simplified model of the NASA Aquarius instrument. Credit: NASA Aquarius.

resources.string: Aquarius data have revealed interesting features in the global ocean, including a salty patch of water in the North Atlantic Ocean. Evaporation of water from this area leaves behind large amounts of salt, contributing to a high-salinity region.
